title: What is the Symbolic Connection Between the Bear and the Seven Rshi in Hindu Tradition?
first_phrase: This text explores the relationship between the names of the bear in different languages and the symbolism of the seven Rshi. The idea is that the Sanskrit word sapta-riksba, which means "seven bears," might correspond with the seven stars in the Big Dipper, but also with the seven Rshi, which are associated with light and wisdom. The text also mentions the relationship between the wolf and the sun in Celtic and Greek mythology. The last part of the text discusses how the name sapta-riksha moved from the Big Dipper to the Pleiades, marking a shift in symbolism from solstices to equinoxes.
